message: Anybody here uses Mutt email client? It's awesome! Any groups here to ask some questions?
is a software like MS outlook?
Have used it for years. There's a command-line-focused issue of Linux Journal with a nice primer. Not sure which month; maybe November 2010?
LOL not. The similarity is because is for reading emails. But it's. Command Line app for unix systems
@aseba oh.. interesting, well right now Im not using ubuntu (the linux distro I use) cuz some problems.. so, that app isnt for windows then?
mutt is awesome and so fast. I run it in screen on a server all the time. Plus you can write mail in vi.
@Josesordo You should be able to run it on Windows via cygwin.
And for Mac OS X fans, you have to install http://www.macports.org/ then in a Terminal type: sudo port install mutt et voilà ;)

Don't know about mutt-specific groups, there was an earlier thread https://convore.com/tech/mutt-style-email-client-for-mac/ I'm a mutt user in Ubuntu, doesn't come pre-installed but it's available, requires more than a little setup as it's only an email agent, but has no way by itself of contacting a server, so you need to setup posix or sendmail. Not for everybody.
@mrtazz Writing mail in your editor-of-choice FTW.
@tremendo I set up msmtp and it works like a charm. Use it with two Gmail IMAP accounts, though separately.
